abstracts.cdata!:
This project paper introduces the
            following changes in the Samoa Telecommunications and Postal
            Sector Reform Project and any accompanying amendments to the
            project's legal documents: (i) extension of the
            International Development Association (IDA) credit through
            October 15, 2010 for a cumulative extension of 2.5 years;
            (ii) reallocation of the credit proceeds; and (iii)
            conversion of the project's logical framework into the
            results framework. These changes will allow completion of
            two key components of the project: (a) the privatization
            transaction of Samoa Tel; and (b) the further strengthening
            of the regulatory framework for the telecommunications
            sector, particularly in the areas of interconnection,
            convergence and downstream effects of privatization. The
            results of both components are important to the development
            of the sector. Likewise, full utilization of the credit and
            adequate monitoring of project implementation and
            achievement of outcomes will be facilitated.
